comment: We couldn't work out how to play this!

Some kind of UNO-variant made worse trying to force a theme to it. You follow suite and hope it doesnâ€™t drag too long.

Artwork aside, I have barely anything good to say. Having more villains appear through the deck is something, at least, so even if you get that first one you have a real reason to accuse someone else. But it's an awful game in nearly every sense.

Unfortunately, this is one of our regulars and I just bite down and bear through. It is only some kind of filler, after all...
Could have been so much better. The game play is confusing and doesn't make much sense. Too bad as we normally like Sherlock Holmes themed games.
The game went on too long and we lost interest after the second round of six.

A few glaring problems - feels like there wasn't enough play testing.
But enjoyable if the company is good.

A really small decision space, with mostly you praying someone plays a card you can play off. I dreaded having to do reshuffles, which just murdered the pacing.

The core of a decent idea is in there, but the implementation leaves much to be desired.
I'm a sucker for the theme but this game meanders a little and can easily outstay it's welcome. Ok once a year.

Really enjoy playing this game, with the randomness and the constraints of what can follow each card. It really understands Sherlock Holmes as well, it isn't just a game where they've slapped SH over the top and called it a day. It's good fun with 4 in my opinion.
I have no idea how often we played this game. Often...very often. We played it, until the cards went blind...
